alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 2:28PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Along the Kenai River from Skilak Lake to Kenai. * WHEN...Until 215 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 224 PM AKDT, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the mainstem Kenai River. High water levels are ongoing or expected to begin shortly along the Kenai River. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Cooper Creek at Mouth near Cooper Landing: At 2:15pm the stage was 10.11 feet. Flood Stage is 14.0 feet. - For Kenai River at Cooper Landing: At 2:00pm the stage was 11.99 feet. Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 12.1 feet is expected around 10:00am Sunday. - For Kenai River at Kenai Keys: At 11:00am the stage was 10.37 feet. Flood Stage is 11.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 10.8 feet is expected around 10:00am Sunday. - For Kenai River below Skilak Lake: At 1:30pm the stage was 12.38 feet. Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 13.0 feet is expected around 10:00am Sunday. Impacts: At 15.0 feet: Water inundates the Kenai Keys neighborhood. - For Kenai River at Soldotna: At 2:00pm the stage was 10.26 feet. Flood Stage is 12.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 10.9 feet is expected around 10:00pm Sunday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
